#Summary1=(human1) In an interview in 2007, Frank Messina, known as the 'Mets Poet', recites a stanza from one of his poems and talks about how his poetry in support of the New York Mets baseball team has touched fans of the team.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Poet Frank Messina discusses his unexpected fame as “The Mets Poet,” explaining how his baseball-themed poetry has attracted new fans and mainstream attention, though it represents only a portion of his extensive work that includes spoken word performances and 9/11-inspired pieces.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) Frank Messina, the 'Mets Poet,' discusses his career, highlighting global performances and the surprising impact of his New York Mets-inspired poetry among sports fans; His work resonates with audiences on various levels, reflecting both personal and collective challenges, drawing comparisons to historical figures like Walt Whitman.

#Summary4=(Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) Frank Messina, a poet and spoken word artist, discusses his recent attention and praise for his Mets-inspired poetry, which he feels overshadows his previous work in poetry, but he finds it meaningful to have touched fans through his work.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Frank Messina, known as the “Mets Poet,” reflects on the impact of his baseball-inspired poetry on fans, including personal interactions and newfound recognition from those typically uninterested in poetry.
#Text=Frank Messina : An Interview with the ' Mets Poet '
#Text=Wednesday , October 3 , 2007
#Text=You have received a good deal of attention recently .

#Text=Even though I 'm not Michael Jackson or somebody , when people come up to me and introduce themselves and say , ' Hey Frank , my name is John , ' I say , ' Hey John , my name is Frank ' and they laugh .
#Text=It 's a funny phenomenon .
#Text=What goes through your head when that happens ?
#Text=I understand it .
#Text=I 've gone to readings and concerts .
#Text=I look at it as human interaction .
#Text=Over the years I have performed in 32 countries and 40 states .
#Text=I 've been doing this professionally since I was in my twenties , and before that since I was sixteen doing little tidbit poetry readings in coffeehouses .
#Text=The band I started in 1993 , Spoken Motion , received a lot of recognition as a spoken word band born out of the New York spoken word scene .
#Text=I worked with some great musicians and performed around the world .
#Text=I remember signing my first autograph to a kid when I was 25 years old .
#Text=As time went on , I came out with books and CDs , and I became used to that kind of thing .
#Text=To me , the ultimate feeling of success as an artist , is to move somebody enough where they thank you .
#Text=When someone comes up and says , ' Frank , thank you , your work is great . "
#Text=Have no fear , no hesitation , for Winning shall be it's reward !
#Text=Do n't let them get in your head !
#Text=you 've kept it up this long
#Text=You 're a Mets fan in late September and you ll fight til the glorious end
#Text=Cheer the team today ; ( your boys in orange and blue ) Let them hear you shout as they fight for what 's mightily due
#Text=( copyright Frank Messina ; reprinted with permission ) "

#Text=Sports fans are n't known as patrons of poetry .

#Text=Have you had interaction with  new readers ' through your Mets work ?

column1: #Text=It was amazing .
#Text=We did n't use the banner this year , though , because we did n't know .
#Text=The team was n't so far ahead that we knew .
#Text=Last year we just knew we were going to the playoffs ; we knew we were going post-season .
#Text=This year we were n't sure .
#Text=We were walking on eggshells .
#Text=There was a woman , a season ticket holder and a die hard fan .
#Text=She was staggered by the loss last year to the Cardinals .
#Text=Last year she came up to me during one of the games late in the season ; she was so happy we were going to the post season .
#Text=By that point we had clinched it .
#Text=She handed me a shirt she bought at the stadium and she gave me a big hug .
#Text=With tears in her eyes she said , " Thank you , Mets Poet , thank you . "
#Text=It 's cool ... it 's like another family .
#Text=Moments like that must make you realize you have touched people who are n't normally touched by poetry .
#Text=It 's opened up a new fan base , so to speak .
#Text=For the last year SNY has broadcast footage of me with my poems , so quite a few fans known about the " Mets Poet ' .
